title: 115_s2063
content: The Act titled "Veterans' Electronic Health Record Modernization Oversight Act of 2017" provides oversight for the electronic health record modernization program. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must submit various documents related to the Electronic Health Record Modernization Program to congressional committees within 30 days of the Act's enactment. These documents include an Integrated Master Plan, Integrated Master Schedule, Program Management Plan, cost estimates, Risk Management Plan, Health IT Strategic Architecture Plan, Transition Plan, and Data Migration Plan. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must provide quarterly updates on various plans related to the Electronic Health Record Modernization Program, including data migration, system security, application implementation, system design, legacy system standardization, health data interoperability, and community care vision. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must submit updated versions of key documents to congressional committees, including the Integrated Master Schedule, Program Management Plan, Performance Baseline Report, Budget Reconciliation Report, Risk Management Plan, and contracts for the Electronic Health Record Modernization Program within five days of awarding. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must notify congressional committees within 10 days of any delays or significant financial changes exceeding $1,000,000 in the Electronic Health Record Modernization Program. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must notify congressional committees within 10 days of any delays, financial changes exceeding $1,000,000, protests, claims, disputes, loss of data, or breaches of patient privacy. The Electronic Health Record Modernization Program involves the Department of Veterans Affairs replacing existing health record systems with a new electronic system. The appropriate congressional committees must be informed of any delays, financial changes exceeding $1,000,000, protests, claims, disputes, loss of data, or breaches of patient privacy within 10 days. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must inform congressional committees about the Electronic Health Record Modernization Program, including details about the Computerized Patient Record System, Joint Legacy Viewer, and Enterprise Health Management Platform, along with any related contracts or agreements.
